title: MAAL Wines / Mora Hughes Arquitectos
description: The project is located in Las Compuertas, Mendoza, Argentina, on a long, narrow site with privileged views of the mountains. In response to the client's desire to build a sustainable winery that would leave the smallest possible carbon footprint, the architects proposed a design based on recycled materials and disused elements, integrating them into a functional and aesthetically unique construction.
author: Paula Pintos

title: W House / Rafael Granero Arquitetura
description: The WU House aims to convey through its architecture the uniqueness of an intercultural family. With strong Chinese and Brazilian influences, the design respects ancient traditions while embracing their characteristics.

title: Exposed Wood Posts & Beams Add A Warm Rustic Touch To This Small Cabin
description: Still Architects has shared photos of a small contemporary cabin they completed in the Muskoka region of Ontario, Canada, where the Rosseau River flows into the lake. The 800-square-foot (74-sqm) cabin has a wood exterior with black accents. Its wood deck, with steps down to the gravel, expands its living space. The heavy Douglas fir […]
author: Erin

description: Blaine Architects together with Marshall Interiors, have completed the renovation of a mid-century modern home in San Mateo, California, for a young couple who wanted to update the kitchen, living room, dining room, and family room. Here’s a glimpse of the original kitchen and entryway… The renovated home includes a pivoting glass front door that […]
author: Erin

title: 5468796 Architecture adds "floating" office floor within preserved pumphouse
description: Local studio 5468796 Architecture has renovated an early 20th-century utilities building in Winnipeg, Canada, showcasing the industrial equipment while updating the structure for contemporary usage. Originally built in 1901 on railway land to help the city's water supply, the James Avenue Pumping Station in Winnipeg forms the centrepiece of the development. The station closed in The post 5468796 Architecture adds "floating" office floor within preserved pumphouse appeared first on Dezeen.
author: Ben Dreith

title: Ao-ft arranges mass-timber house around contours of London plane tree
description: A tall plane tree forms a focal point for Tree Courtyard House, a home with a cross-laminated timber structure on a backland site in east London by local studio Ao-ft. Tucked behind Walthamstow Village's main shopping street, the two-bed house is designed to blend into its surroundings with dark brown-brick walls that Ao-ft said "minimise attention".
